python101.name: Chapter 4: Operators
python101.content: Overview of Python operators: arithmetic, comparison, logical, assignment, bitwise, identity, membership, ternary, and precedence.

sections.title: Operators and Operands
sections.content:
Operators work on operands (values/variables).

Example:
```python
a = 3
b = 2
c = a + b  # + is the operator, a and b are operands
```

sections.title: Arithmetic Operators
sections.content:
`+  -  *  /  //  %  **`

```python
a = 17
b = 5

print(a + b)   # 22  addition
print(a - b)   # 12  subtraction
print(a * b)   # 85  multiplication
print(a / b)   # 3.4 true division (float)
print(a // b)  # 3   floor division
print(a % b)   # 2   remainder
print(a ** 2)  # 289 power
```

sections.title: Comparison (Relational) Operators
sections.content:
`==  !=  <  <=  >  >=` (return True or False)

```python
x = 8
y = 12

print(x == y)   # False
print(x != y)   # True
print(x < y)    # True
print(x >= y)   # False
```

sections.title: Logical Operators
sections.content:
`and  or  not`

```python
is_admin = True
has_token = False

print(is_admin and has_token)  # False
print(is_admin or has_token)   # True
print(not is_admin)            # False
```

Precedence: `not` > `and` > `or`.

sections.title: Bitwise Operators
sections.content:
`&  |  ^  ~  <<  >>` (operate on bits of integers)

```python
a = 6   # 110
b = 3   # 011

print(a & b)   # 2   AND
print(a | b)   # 7   OR
print(a ^ b)   # 5   XOR
print(~a)      # -7  NOT
print(a << 1)  # 12  shift left
print(a >> 1)  # 3   shift right
```

sections.title: Identity Operators
sections.content:
`is`, `is not` compare object identity (same object in memory).

```python
a = [1, 2]
b = [1, 2]
c = a

print(a == b)     # True  (same contents)
print(a is b)     # False (different objects)
print(a is c)     # True  (same object)
print(a is not b) # True
```

sections.title: Membership Operators
sections.content:
`in`, `not in` check if a value is inside a sequence.

```python
nums = [2, 4, 6]

print(4 in nums)        # True
print(5 in nums)        # False
print(5 not in nums)    # True

text = 'python'
print('py' in text)     # True
```

sections.title: Ternary (Conditional) Operator
sections.content:
One-line if/else:

Pattern:
```python
result = a if condition else b
```

Example:
```python
age = 17
status = 'adult' if age >= 18 else 'minor'
print(status)  # minor
```

sections.title: Precedence and Associativity
sections.content:
- Precedence: which operator is applied first.
- Associativity: order when precedence is the same (usually left to right; `**` is right to left).

```python
expr = 10 + 2 * 3
print(expr)           # 16  (* before +)

print(2 ** 3 ** 2)    # 512  (2 ** (3 ** 2))

print(100 / 10 * 10)  # 100.0  (left to right)

x = True
y = False
z = False

print(x or y and z)   # True  (and before or)
# same as: x or (y and z)
```

When unsure, add parentheses to make the order clear.
